examples: The Supreme Court reached the conclusion that teachers and students who disagree with the Pledge have the right not to say it.

images.alt: Photo of a hand holding a wooden gavel.
images.description: A hand holding a wooden gavel, or mallet. The gavel rests on a wooden circle.
images.caption: The decision of a court is often the conclusion, or end, of a disagreement.

examples: Students across the country recite the Pledge of Allegiance daily.

images.alt: Photo of a group of people saying the Pledge of Allegiance.
images.description: Photo of a group of people, with hands over their hearts, reciting the Pledge of Allegiance.
images.caption: Just about every American knows the U.S. Pledge of Allegiance.

examples: Harold feels he owes allegiance to his friends because of the help they gave him.
The American flag signifies freedom for many people.

images.alt: Photo of the Statue of Liberty
images.description: Photo of the Statue of Liberty with an American flag flying in the background.
images.caption: For many people, the Statue of Liberty signifies (or symbolizes) the freedom that America offers to immigrants.

meanings.definition: A rule or belief that guides actions.
examples: Supporters of the Pledge argue that it reflects the principles of most Americans.

meanings.definition: The action of being moved apart.
examples: The constitution says that there should be a separation of religion and government.

images.description: The photo shows road with a car driving on it. A narrow lane is separated from the main road by a low curb. This lane is for bike riders only.
images.caption: The separation of bike riders and cars keeps everyone safe.

examples: What other people say supports his story.

meanings.definition: A small group of words that are together.
examples: Though it was only a minor part of the song, Adam poured all his energy into creating the short phrase to make it both meaningful and memorable.

images.alt: Photo of hearts with a few words on them.
images.description: The hearts in this photo each have a few words printed on them. The words are phrases, or expressions. The words on the hearts are, 'CALL ME', 'KISS ME', 'TRUE LOVE', 'FOREVER YOURS', 'BE MINE', and 'XOXOXO'.
images.caption: The words on each of these hearts express an idea.

examples: I looked through the different candies for the specific one that I wanted.

images.alt: Photo of different cereal packages on a shelf.
images.description: Two shelves of cereal boxes are shown. The cereal boxes on the upper shelf include Cheerios with protein, Apple Cinnamon Cheerios, Fruity Cheerios, Captain Crunch, Sprinkled Donut Crunch, Honey Smacks, and Corn Pops. More cereal boxes are shown on the lower shelf.
images.caption: There are so many types of cereal, each with a specific flavor.

source.title: New Cap'n Crunch's Sprinkled Donut Crunch
source.author: albedo20

meanings.definition: An explanation or decision for a problem.
examples: Eliza worked hard to figure out the solution to the math problem.
